ygData.subject: Re: Cash and experience
ygData.msgSnippet: I spent most of my last big cash reserve on wis gear. Just thinking of adding an item or two in the future. You are right, the money won t be critical until I
ygData.messageBody:
I spent most of my last big cash reserve on wis gear. Just thinking
of adding an item or two in the future. You are right, the money
won't be critical until I get closer to my next spell level. Just
wondering if I could do both.

At present I spend part of my time in Velious, getting exp. The other
part I spend in Misty Thicket, foraging Misty Acorns. I have found a
minor money mine there. Running around looking for the ground drops
of acorns is not too productive. Forage, though rare, is better. So,
while I wait for forage to clear, I kill the conveniently grouped
diseased rats. The 1pp tails and a few stackable high-gold items make
the time at least somewhat productive.

The present course, until it gets just too boring, is hunt kitties
for one bubble of exp, then off to Misty until I find an acorn. Then
back to Velious for another round.

Starting to feel like a job. ;)

Barto Proudfoot

--- In EverQuest@y..., Rob LeBeau <rlebeau65@y...> wrote:
> What do you need the cash really for? Meaning, if you
> made lots of cash then why not just find a place where
> the exp is Excellent. My attitude is you can always
> make money in the higher levels. Or take up a trade
> like pottery and get your skill up to make things that
> sell for good PP.
>
> Just my 2 cents...... I have a 32 druid and currently
> hunt in the Overthere and I find the PP good as well
> as the exp. But I am grouping since lots of baddies
> resist spells.
>
> Hope this helps
>
> Rob
> --- mlockridge01 <MLockridge01@c...> wrote:
> > I have been hunting Snow Cougars in Iceclad for a
> > level and a half.
> > The experience is good, and whether solo or duo the
> > time invested is
> > about the same. Not bad, but I am not making any
> > money.
> >
> > Previously I farmed Brutes in Warsliks Woods.
> > Nominal experience, but
> > made lots of cash.
> >
> > Any ideas where I can go as a lvl 35 Druid to get a
> > good balance of
> > cash/loot and experience? Mostly I solo, as I am
> > usually in for an
> > hour at a time. Get in a few hours together now and
> > then, but for
> > short sessions getting a group consumes most of the
> > time available.
> >
> > Barto Proudfoot
> >
> >
>
>
